title: Follow live: Knicks, Pacers in tight contest with Game 6 on the line
author: ESPN Staff
excerpt: The Pacers will look to close out the Eastern Conference finals while the Knicks hope to force a Game 7.
text: The best Tyrese Haliburton dishes of the playoffs (0:40)Check out Tyrese Haliburton's top assists from the Pacers' playoff run so far. (0:40)ESPN staffMay 31, 2025, 08:07 PM ETThe Indiana Pacers will have another shot to punch their ticket to the NBA Finals.The Pacers return home to Gainbridge Fieldhouse for Game 6 of the Eastern Conference finals against the New York Knicks, whom they lead in the series 3-2.Indiana is coming off a Game 5 111-94 loss to the Knicks, who forced Game 6 behind Jalen Brunson's dominant 32-point performance and Karl-Anthony Towns' 24 points and 13 rebounds.Saturday could turn into a repeat of the 2000 Eastern Conference Finals, where the Pacers defeated the Knicks 93-80 in Game 6 to advance to the NBA Finals, where they faced the Los Angeles Lakers.New York collected a win over Indiana in Game 3 -- the first game of the series in Indiana -- when the Knicks completed a 20-point comeback led by Towns' 24 points and 15 rebounds.The Knicks will look to rely on big performances from their big men -- Towns and Mitchell Robinson -- and the star power of Brunson to stay alive.Brunson has scored 189 points from drives, the third-most points scored from drives in a single postseason, according to ESPN Research.Will Indiana advance to face the Oklahoma City Thunder for the Larry O'Brien Trophy, or can New York force a Game 7? html:
• ESPN staffMay 31, 2025, 08:07 PM ET

The Indiana Pacers will have another shot to punch their ticket to the NBA Finals.

The Pacers return home to Gainbridge Fieldhouse for Game 6 of the Eastern Conference finals against the New York Knicks, whom they lead in the series 3-2.

Indiana is coming off a Game 5 111-94 loss to the Knicks, who forced Game 6 behind Jalen Brunson's dominant 32-point performance and Karl-Anthony Towns' 24 points and 13 rebounds.

Saturday could turn into a repeat of the 2000 Eastern Conference Finals, where the Pacers defeated the Knicks 93-80 in Game 6 to advance to the NBA Finals, where they faced the Los Angeles Lakers.

New York collected a win over Indiana in Game 3 -- the first game of the series in Indiana -- when the Knicks completed a 20-point comeback led by Towns' 24 points and 15 rebounds.

The Knicks will look to rely on big performances from their big men -- Towns and Mitchell Robinson -- and the star power of Brunson to stay alive.

Brunson has scored 189 points from drives, the third-most points scored from drives in a single postseason, according to ESPN Research.

Will Indiana advance to face the Oklahoma City Thunder for the Larry O'Brien Trophy, or can New York force a Game 7? Follow along with live updates, highlights and best moments.
